Name: Artwork
Description: Visual artwork is a piece of art created primarily for visual perception.

Properties.Name: Art Form
Properties.Description: The medium or form of expression the artist chooses to employ. Examples: photography, painting, sculpture, etc.

Properties.Name: Art Genre
Properties.Description: Categorization of the subject of the artwork. Examples of art genre: portrait, landscape, still life, history (grande genre), abstract art, scenes of everyday life (genre works, or petit genre).

Properties.Name: Edition of
Properties.Description: If this artwork is an edition of a work of art, for example, a cast of a sculpture or a print of a photograph, you can enter a topic for the "abstract" or "canonical" work of art - the artwork that this is an edition of.

Properties.Name: Media
Properties.Description: The substance the artistic work is made from. For example acrylic and oil are two media common to painting.

Properties.Name: Support
Properties.Description: The support is the substance that a two-dimensional artwork is applied to. For example, the support of many oil paintings is canvas; for many lithographs, it is paper. This should not be used for the ground, which is the material applied to the support to prepare it, such as gesso.

Properties.Name: Period or Movement
Properties.Description: The school or style of the artwork, commonly associated with a distinct period in history, and often end in "-ism". Examples: Impressionism, Cubism, Expressionism.
